An intern misused blum integers to generate an RSA key. The CEO's secret is encrypted: 106105989122045186317622031806538665236845106701469750315766506627980982421152675837718704237334953094112613517518676201554573853498474097663418279156278. Can you exploit the flaw and recover the message?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7387902894044471754363436639233463654410159783471063768376425015050102105032798594054441377519191513194040564165572858045652553401269441324861464989131189, e=4974477177570482126102852648324112060917228742087397963964438631717172324092494054458347077440674201437760980010864601284677078043692110999401691800208373
The lower 104 bits of p are: 17350541312325606920542356270148711471


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{q7p8n6rg}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 106105989122045186317622031806538665236845106701469750315766506627980982421152675837718704237334953094112613517518676201554573853498474097663418279156278
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7387902894044471754363436639233463654410159783471063768376425015050102105032798594054441377519191513194040564165572858045652553401269441324861464989131189, e=4974477177570482126102852648324112060917228742087397963964438631717172324092494054458347077440674201437760980010864601284677078043692110999401691800208373
The lower 104 bits of p are: 17350541312325606920542356270148711471

extra_info: p=74166891947640925741753988037635626912708745025095908492612790441572095980591, q=99611871281596337079884412482980995618773319583424165830353597415451926559579, Ï†(n)=7387902894044471754363436639233463654410159783471063768376425015050102105032624815291212140256369874793519947543041375981044033326946474937004440966591020
